image.altText: Jari Wise looks over his shoulder at the camera.

props.synopsis: It was a dramatic start to the long-awaited inquest into the death of a man who was killed afterÂ a car driven by his former partner struck him in a town south of Hobart in 2020, with one witness arrested and another warned over her behaviour.

title.children: 'He's dead, he's not coming back': One witness arrested, another warned by coroner, on day one of Jari Wise inquest

image.altText: An Indigenous flag flaps in the wind against a blue sky background

props.synopsis: The commission also that found that if governments continue to put money towards programs that don't align with what the community is saying will work, then governments will continue to allocate public money ineffectively.

title.children: Commission's first review reveals 'tokenistic' Closing the Gap strategies falling short

image.altText: A drone shot of a new housing estate, with houses stretching as far as the eye can see

props.synopsis: There are two things the prime minister needs to get into his head about tax. One is that saying he won't make any further changes no longer works. The other is that negative gearing doesn't do much to get people into homes, writes Peter Martin.

title.children: Negative gearing is as Australian as meat pie and sauce. Is it time to stop rewarding landlords who can't make money?

image.altText: A women with blonde hair tied back into a ponytail looks towards the camera.

props.synopsis: The former head of medical services at a major Tasmanian hospital allegedly falsified medical certificates of death, a registered nurse and midwife tells a parliamentary committee.

title.children: Launceston hospital former top doctor allegedly covered up causes of death to avoid coronial scrutiny, nurse claims

image.altText: A graphic image of a plane flying away from Australia, with dotted red lines radiating from Victoria.

props.synopsis: Dozens of MPs claimed travel allowances last year after trips across the globe, with integrity experts warning that politicians' claims must 'pass the pub test'.

title.children: Victorian politicians racked up nearly half a million dollars in travel bills last financial year. Here's how they spent it

image.altText: RBA governor Michele Bullock holds her hand up while speaking at a press conference.

props.synopsis: In just half a sentence, the Reserve Bank board dashed the rate cut hopes of millions of mortgage borrowers. Does it risk condemning the Australian economy to recession as well?

title.children: Talk to the hand: RBA silences rate cut talk, but is it mostly for show?

image.altText: King Charles waves to a crowd as Queen Camilla walks ahead.

props.synopsis: When Charles became king, he moved to expand the number of counsellors of state who could carry out his duties if he were to become seriously ill. The move may have foreshadowed this exact scenario, saving him from potentially awkward speculation about what role Prince Harry and Prince Andrew could play while he recovers.

title.children: King Charles III diagnosis may have been a shock, but one decision has saved him from further scrutiny

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, wearing a hat, walks among indigenous performers.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has denied his government has failed to outline a way forward on Indigenous policy following last year's unsuccessful Voice referendum.

title.children: PM says government is 'looking for other ways to bring about' progress on Closing the Gap targets

image.altText: Ben Yole talks to someone at a horse stables.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian harness trainer at the centre of race fixing, team driving and animal welfare breaches in the industry launches an appeal against his "warning off" from racetracks.

title.children: Australia's biggest harness racing trainer appealing ban in wake of explosive report

image.altText: A middle aged man in a black legal gown sits in a wood-lined court room.

props.synopsis: An interstate magistrate will be called in to hear a criminal case involving Tasmanian Supreme Court judge Gregory Geason. Justice Geason has pleaded not guilty to charges of common assault, and emotional abuse or intimidation.Â

title.children: 'That includes me': Tasmanian magistrates ruled out from hearing criminal case against Supreme Court Justice

image.altText: Young Wollemi Pine.

props.synopsis: The Wollemi Pine was thought to have gone extinct two million years ago, until an off-duty ranger stumbled across a grove. Now, experts are doing everything they can to give the tree a second chance.Â

title.children: The top secret mission to preserve the 'botanical find of the century'

props.synopsis: Fiji's former prime minister Frank Bainimarama will spend the night in police custody after being charged with abuse of office.

title.children: Fiji's former PM Frank Bainimarama to spend night behind bars after abuse of office charge

image.altText: Thieves are targeting housing estates

props.synopsis: Bendigo housing estate residents sayÂ they they're installing "cameras and padlocks everywhere" following a spate of "scary" attempted break-ins and thefts.

title.children: Residents fortifying homes in estate where brazen would-be thieves caught on camera trying doors

image.altText: Woman holds her lower back as she sits at a desk

props.synopsis: Low back pain is the leading cause of disability but there's some big roadblocks if you want to get the best treatment, which focuses on the mind just as much as the body.

title.children: Got a sore lower back? Here's how long the pain is likely to last and what treatments can help

image.altText: Man exhaling e-cigarette vapour into the air, right, into the face of another man, left

props.synopsis: A doctor and public health expert weigh in on how to limit passive vaping exposure and what you can do to protect yourself in social situations.

title.children: What is passive vaping, and does it pose as high a risk as second-hand smoking?

image.altText: A woman at the train station in the evening checks her smartphone

props.synopsis: If you've ever found yourself replying to a 10pm email, or fielding a phone call from the boss during a Saturday afternoon barbecue, and wondered "should I be getting paid for this?", the answer is â¦ maybe.

title.children: You might soon have the right to 'disconnect' from work. Here's what else may be on the way

image.altText: A man and a woman sitting in a car smiling and waving

props.synopsis: Prince Harry arrives in London and spends about 45 minutes at his father's royal residence, Clarence House, on Tuesday as King Charles III is pictured for the first time since his cancer diagnosis was made public.

title.children: Harry's flying 45-minute visit after King Charles III's cancer diagnosis

image.altText: A 70-year-old woman with shoulder length brown hair sitting down.

props.synopsis: Five teenagers have been charged as police continue to investigate the stabbing death of a 70-year-old grandmother at an Ipswich shopping centre.

title.children: Parents of teens arrested over grandmother's death at shopping centre 'condemn what's occurred,' police say

image.altText: Teenagers harass supermarket

props.synopsis: Concerns are raised about groups of children stealing from supermarkets, after a "distressing" incident at a remote Kimberley store during which teens stole drinks and confectionary and tried to break into a cigarette cabinet.

title.children: Teens scare staff while 'swarming' remote supermarket, sparking fears of wider trend

image.altText: A man on stage holding a guitar.

props.synopsis: In a statement on social media, Toby Keith's family said the singer "passed peacefully" on Monday night.

title.children: Country music singer Toby Keith dies aged 62

image.altText: Michele Bullock, looking at journalists, wearing a light blazer, standing at a podium, during a press conference

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank Board keeps interest rates at 4.35 per cent following inflation falling by more than expected towards the end of 2023.

title.children: RBA boss doesn't rule out future increases as rates hold at 4.35pc

image.altText: A close up of an Indigenous Australian woman sitting and smiling indoors, with other people sitting behind her

props.synopsis: The late Lowitja O'DonoghueÂ is being remembered for her trailblazing spirit, with leaders acknowledging she changed Australia's relationship with Indigenous affairs.

title.children: 'A compliment and a whack': Prime ministers reflect on Lowitja's legacy

image.altText: A screenshot with a red box highlighting some Chinese characters that were changed in a transcript of a press conference.

props.synopsis: Yesterday, China sentenced Yang Hengjun to death. But a minor tweak in a press conference transcript from years ago sheds light on a potential reprieve, writes Bang Xiao.

title.children: Beijing edits Yang Hengjun's online record in a hint of what might lie ahead

image.altText: An AFL football executive stands at a lectern as she answers questions, while a colleague stands behind and off to the side.

props.synopsis: The AFL has announced that players who leave the ground attempting to smother the ball will be deemed careless if they make high contact, in the wake of last year's controversial Brayden Maynard case.

title.children: AFL change the smother rule for 2024 after Brayden Maynard case

image.altText: KarolinaÂ Shiino poses for photos with a gold Miss Japan trophy.

props.synopsis: The Ukrainian-born winner of this year's Miss Japan beauty pageant says she has renounced her title after a magazine published an article about her affair with a married man.

title.children: Ukrainian-born Miss Japan gives up her title after magazine reveals affair with a married man

image.altText: Three separate images detailing the injuries a woman suffered in a assault, showing black eyes and swelling.

props.synopsis: A woman violently assaulted during a night out in Kalgoorlie shares the physical and emotional trauma she has suffered since, as her attackerÂ has his prison sentence suspended.

title.children: FIFO worker avoids jail over taxi rank attack that left woman unconscious

image.altText: A composite of two screenshots from social media videos showing Tesla drivers using Apple Vision Pro headsets while driving

props.synopsis: The US transportation secretary warns drivers must pay attention at all times, even if their car has assisted driving capabilities.

title.children: Viral videos of Tesla drivers using Apple's Vision Pro prompt US government warning

image.altText: Adam Britton stands by greenery wearing a green shirt

props.synopsis: Disgraced zoologist Adam Britton pleaded guilty in September to 60 offences, including bestiality, possessing child abuse material and other animal cruelty charges.

title.children: Further delays to 'sadistic' zoologist's bestiality and child abuse material sentencing

image.altText: A man wearing a light blue suit looks out the corner of his eyes as he walks up steps

props.synopsis: The former Wallaby player repeatedly apologised for 'misreading the situation' in a call to the complainant recorded by police.

title.children: Kurtley Beale told manager in tapped call 'a bird' said she hadn't consented to oral sex, court told

image.altText: Clive Palmer poses for a photograph in front of a statue of Jeff the dinosaur.

props.synopsis: Billionaire businessman and former politician Clive Palmer has lost his Court of Appeal bid to have criminal charges against him and his company thrown out, with three judges determining he "abused" the court process.

title.children: Clive Palmer loses appeal to have criminal charges thrown out

image.altText: A close-up photo of a man standing next to a woman with a blurred face.

props.synopsis: Alberto Nicoletti, the former owner and manager of an Italian restaurant in Como, has pleaded not guilty to 11 charges for a series of alleged sexual assaults.

title.children: Italian restaurant owner on trial over string of alleged sexual assaults on women across Perth

image.altText: A sweeping view of an outback property with brown water covering most of it.

props.synopsis: Landholders in eastern parts of the country are still in shock after ex-Tropical Cyclone Kirrily caused a year's worth of rain to fall in just two days, drenching their properties.

title.children: Graziers describe 'unbelievable' rainfall in parts of far north-west NSW and south-west Queensland

image.altText: An unusual looking dolphin with multicoloured skin.

props.synopsis: Researchers believe they have recorded one of the world's most unusually coloured dolphins for the first time in Australian waters.

title.children: Rare dolphin, only photographed six times, believed to be spotted in Australian waters

image.altText: Lucy kisses her Grammy as Phoebe leans in and laughs as Taylor Swift ducks into the group photo as well.

props.synopsis: The Grammys hit a high note this year, drawing an audience of nearly 17 million viewers as the three-hour ceremony focused on celebrating some of the most successful women in the industry.

title.children: Grammys emerge from flop era as viewership jumps 34 per cent

image.altText: a man looking

props.synopsis: Youssef Assoum was shot in the leg at close range in December 2014 and died from severe blood loss, court documents read.

title.children: Former Comanchero kingpin and brother have murder charges dropped after plea deal
